feature1.explanation: Different use of punctuation marks observed in the two texts.

feature2.explanation: Distinct lexical choices and word usage in each text.

feature3.explanation: Varied sentence structures and lengths between the texts.

feature4.explanation: Difference in tone and mood in the two texts.

feature5.explanation: No apparent spelling or typographical errors in either text.

overall.explanation: Based on the analysis of punctuation style, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure and quantitative features, text and discourse features, and spelling and typographical errors, the likelihood of the two texts being written by the same author is low.
